The President needs to show China and the rest of the world that we will stand with Taiwan. We cannot waiver in our defense of democracy. Aggression by China against the U.S. and our allies cannot be tolerated by the administration. 

We must stand firm against China. The latest hypersonic tests are just another example of dangerous behavior from China. This threat is real, and it‚Äôs happening now. The Biden Admin. needs to show China, and the rest of the world, we will NOT allow this type of aggression.

tweets: 
Fair to question China data, but trend is clear & represents deep crisis in US. Fear/alienation can‚Äôt solve this bc cynical politics needs misery to survive. Biden had a chance to offer hope last week; instead he placed universal blame for all ills at Republicans‚Äô feet. (1/2) 

China hates this bill bc it will degrade CCP‚Äôs ability to build chips under 28 nanometers and bolster advanced (sub 13nm) chip production in the US, which is essential for our future competitiveness. I was more than happy to stand against the Chinese Communist Party today. (3/3) 

Dems played politics with China competition legislation for over a year, introducing bloated proposals like America Competes instead of a focused package on semiconductor investment, R&D, + supply chains. (2/3) Good summary of CHIPS+ by @klonkitchen here: 

Today, I joined GOP leaders of the Foreign Affairs and Intelligence committees to vote in favor of CHIPS+, which includes funding for the CHIPS Act, my FABS Act, my National Supply Chain Database Act, and other vital legislation to compete w/ China. (1/3) 

They went with CHIPS & Science when CHIPS & SALSA (Sustaining American Leadership in Scientific Affairs) was right there. 

I stand with @EnesFreedom. Shame on the @NBA for kowtowing to CCP pressure to keep Chinese $$$ (¬•¬•¬•) flowing. Beyond pathetic that the NBA condones the perpetrators of atrocity, reserving punishment only for those *speaking out* against Uyghur genocide. 

Today I voted against the America Competes Act, despite it having several provisions I support (including CHIPS, NSF For the Future, etc). Why? Because instead of letting good bills go to the floor for a vote, @SpeakerPelosi bundled them together in a 2900 page bill (1/2) 

Proud to co-sponsor @RepBera‚Äôs HR 5580 ‚ÄòCountering China Economic Coercion Act‚Äô

	location: Michigan

Á§æ‰∫§Â±ûÊÄß

tweets: 
We‚Äôre bringing good-paying chip manufacturing jobs to Michigan! Thanks to new laws I helped pass, like the CHIPS and Science Act, and union workers like Jeffery, we‚Äôre making more things in Michigan, not overseas. 

I recently hosted @POTUS in Bay City, where new investments in American manufacturing are creating good-paying jobs! #CHIPSandScienceAct 

When workers have jobs with good wages and benefits, they support themselves, their families & the economy. New laws I helped pass, like the CHIPS & Science Act, are already helping create good-paying Michigan jobs. I‚Äôll fight to strengthen worker rights & the middle class. 

We need to manufacture more here in Michigan‚Äînot overseas‚Äîto strengthen our supply chains. That‚Äôs why I helped pass the bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act. This new law is already creating hundreds of good-paying Michigan jobs, & I‚Äôll keep working to strengthen U.S. manufacturing. 

Hundreds of new jobs are coming to mid-Michigan! Thanks to the CHIPS and Science Act, we‚Äôre strengthening American manufacturing and creating good-paying Michigan jobs at companies like Hemlock Semiconductor. 

We cannot depend on other countries for critical components to our economy like chips. That‚Äôs why I worked with Republicans and Democrats to pass the CHIPS and Science Act into law‚Äîhelping to make today‚Äôs groundbreaking at Hemlock Semiconductor possible. 

It‚Äôs no surprise Flint workers are producing some of the most popular trucks on the market; we put the world on wheels! I helped pass the CHIPS and Science Act to strengthen American auto manufacturing & create good-paying manufacturing jobs here in Michigan‚Äînot overseas. 

Michigan put the world on wheels a century ago. A lot has changed since then, but Michigan workers remain the best in the world. I voted for the CHIPS and Science Act & Inflation Reduction Act so Michigan remains a leader in auto manufacturing, keeping good-paying jobs at home. 

Over the last two years, we‚Äôve seen thousands of jobs created in mid-Michigan. Legislation I helped pass like the CHIPS and Science Act and the Inflation Reduction Act are helping to boost U.S. manufacturing and strengthen domestic supply chains. 

Mid-Michigan put the world on wheels. 150 good-paying jobs at SK Siltron‚Äôs new Bay City facility shows that we can bring back manufacturing to Michigan with new laws like the CHIPS and Science Act & Inflation Reduction Act. 

More good-paying jobs are coming to mid-Michigan! New laws I helped pass, like the CHIPS & Science Act and the Inflation Reduction Act, are poised to create 170 new good-paying jobs. I'll continue working to pass legislation that creates manufacturing jobs in MI‚ÄîNOT overseas. 

We have to make things in Michigan & America if we want to be a strong & prosperous country. The CHIPS and Science Act, which is now law, boosts manufacturing here‚ÄîNOT in China. 

Helped open SK Siltron‚Äôs new manufacturing plant in Bay County! This semiconductor plant is creating 150 good-paying jobs here in mid-Michigan. It‚Äôs a great example of how the CHIPS and Science Act is helping our local economy grow. 

This facility is why I helped pass the CHIPS and Science Act‚Äîto bring critical manufacturing back to Michigan. I‚Äôll keep working to create good-paying jobs in mid-Michigan and decrease our reliance on foreign-made chips. 

The CHIPS & Science Act, which was recently signed into law, includes my legislation to help make more semiconductors in America. These investments will help us compete against China, lower costs for families & create good-paying jobs.

When we make things in Michigan and America, we have a strong and prosperous country. New laws I helped pass‚Äîlike the CHIPS and Science Act‚Äîare bringing good-paying jobs back home. 

By investing in American clean energy and manufacturing, the #InflationReductionAct is creating good-paying manufacturing jobs in Michigan‚Äînot in China. Look no further than mid-Michigan's @hscpoly in Hemlock, hiring Michigan workers to support our solar supply chain.

With this new law, we‚Äôre going to make more semiconductors here in America‚ÄîNOT China. Made in the USA = good-paying jobs, fixing broken supply chains & lowering costs for families. 

At @HscPoly in Hemlock today to celebrate the passage of the CHIPS and Science Act! Our economy shouldn‚Äôt be reliant on foreign-made semiconductors from China. This bipartisan legislation means thousands of Michigan JOBS and lower costs for consumers. 

Semiconductors are in everything‚Äîfrom cars to phones. We need to make more chips in America! By incentivizing semiconductor manufacturing, we can lower costs, boost MI‚Äôs economy, create good-paying jobs & ensure that we have resilient supply chains that don‚Äôt rely on China.

In my hometown of Flint, cars are sitting in parking lots‚Äîjust waiting for foreign-made semiconductor chips. I‚Äôm working to boost the domestic production of these chips, to support Michigan jobs and fix broken supply chains. 

American-made cars shouldn‚Äôt be reliant on foreign-made semiconductor chips. I‚Äôm working in Congress to bring this critical manufacturing back to America and create good-paying Michigan jobs. My legislation will help lower costs for consumers and strengthen our economy.

We cannot be reliant on China for solar panels made with slave labor. Michigan workers can out-compete anyone, but only if they have a level playing field. I‚Äôll keep working in Congress to support Michigan workers and stand up for America‚Äôs solar industry. 

Thousands of cars are sitting in Flint, just waiting for foreign made chips. That's unacceptable. I'm proud to work with Republicans and Democrats to help bring this kind of critical manufacturing back to America by investing in Michigan workers. 

Because of the #AmericanRescuePlan, we are seeing the fastest economic growth rate in nearly 40 years. In one year we have seen:  6.5 million jobs added  Unemployment dropped to around 4 percent  Economic growth faster any other nation, including China #SOTU

The #AmericaCOMPETESAct will help fix our broken supply chains by building more critical components like semiconductors here in America‚Äînot overseas in China‚Äîhelping lower costs for families and seniors. 

When we strengthen domestic manufacturing, we can fix supply chain issues, create jobs here in the U.S. and lower costs for families. The #AmericaCOMPETESAct will promote making things in America and ensure we are not dependent on China for our economic future.

We must level the playing field for Michigan workers. I‚Äôm proud to support the #COMPETESAct to secure our critical supply chains, lower costs & invest in critical innovation to ensure we can compete in a 21st century economy and be economically competitive against China.

This is huge news! When we incentivize U.S. manufacturing and make things here in America, supply chain issues won't be a major disruption in the future. I've been leading bipartisan efforts to strengthen U.S. supply chains & address the chips shortage: 

Fire up Chips!   

I applaud @POTUS for signing this bipartisan legislation into law. This new law will ensure that Chinese products are not made with forced labor, upholding our democratic values as Americans and leveling the playing field for Michigan workers against unfair trade practices.

tweets: 
We need to pass the CHIPS bill to keep US manufacturing competitive. Otherwise, we risk losing billions in investments and countless jobs. The Senate must pass this bill and send it to the House ASAP!

Israel is not an apartheid state. @amnestyUK‚Äôs sham report snubs the only vibrant, multi-ethnic democracy in the Middle East while they continually ignore actual human rights abuses in North Korea, China, and Iran. 

Strengthening domestic manufacturing is a top priority for me & a critical mission as we look to compete with China & emerge as a global & economic leader in the 21st Century. Read more about bipartisan legislation I helped intro to KEEP jobs in  #MI06 

For months, the Biden Admin has resorted to importing oil & gas from the Middle East, Russia, & even China to solve their policy blunders. I suggest that we encourage American energy production here at home that will actually lower gas prices and heating bills for folks in #MI06. 

The Ocean Shipping Reform Act - intro'd by my @ProbSolveCaucus colleague @RepDustyJohnson - is good, bipartisan legislation that will help unclog our ports & hold Chinese freighters accountable that refuse to transport American goods. Securing our supply chain is a TOP priority. 

The Strategic Petroleum Reserve was designed for energy emergencies, not policy blunders. Instead of relying on Russia & China for our energy needs, we should be boosting energy production in America. Check out my bill w/ @cathymcmorris & @SteveScalise 

üö®On Tuesday night, I voted for the FY 22 National Defense Authorization Act which received STRONG, BIPARTISAN support. This bill includes: A pay raise for our troops Resources to deter Chinese & Russian aggression A commission to study the botched Afghanistan withdrawal

China spent more in 3 years on cement than we‚Äôve spent in 100. If we want to emerge as a global leader on trade & economic might, we better get with it on infrastructure. From broadband & energy security to roads & bridges, rebuilding our infrastructure is the least we can do.

Lowering prescription drug costs & finding more cures to the world's cruelest diseases doesn't have to be mutually exclusive. Unfortunately, my Dem colleagues' partisan govt pricing drug plan would stifle innovation, empower China & lead to fewer lifesaving cures for patients. 

The U.S. produces only 12% of the global chip supply compared to some 37% in 1990. They are critical to our economy & our national security. That‚Äôs why we need to fund the CHIPS for America Act & increase domestic chip manufacturing in MI & nationwide. 

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill is a long overdue investment in American infrastructure, American jobs & American competitiveness. To help solve the supply chain crisis & compete w/ China, we need to repave our roads & highways, rebuild our bridges & modernize our ports. #MI06 

China has invested more money in rebuilding their infrastructure in just 3 years than we‚Äôve spent in 100. That needs to change. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill will help us compete against the likes of China, power the American economy, and support American workers.  

In 2019, America was energy independent for the first time in 70 years. Now, we‚Äôre relying on OPEC, Russia & China to power our economy. Releasing oil from the SPR is a very temporary measure that won‚Äôt solve our supply chain issues or reduce gas prices. 

We can‚Äôt continue to rely on foreign countries for the chips American businesses & consumers need. That‚Äôs why @RepDebDingell & I are urging House leadership to fully fund the CHIPS for America Act. This bipartisan bill will go a long way to secure American chip manufacturing. 

If the Democrats' $4T tax-&-spend plan becomes law, the U.S. will have the HIGHEST tax rate in the WORLD. This will only hurt hardworking Americans & small businesses, while helping China & Russia. We should be LOWERING taxes - not aiding our adversaries. 

‚Ä¶expand broadband to underserved communities, strengthen our energy grid against Russian & Chinese cyberattacks & create jobs across SW MI‚Ä¶

Republicans have offered several commonsense amendments to the partisan $3.5T spending spree that would: Cut taxes for our farmers Secure  energy independence End our reliance on Chinese supply chains Fund the police Unfortunately, Democrats blocked them all. #MI06

For 100 years, the CCP has subjugated the Chinese people to ineffective one-party rule, silenced political dissidents & committed glaring human rights abuses. This anniversary is no time for celebration. It‚Äôs a real reminder that freedom is a gift & democracy is precious. #MI06 

Tragically, more than 4M people - including 600K Americans - have died from COVID & we still know very little abt the origins of this awful virus. That needs to change. The Chinese Communist Party owes the world, & so many grieving families, answers. Now.

tweets: 
Under no circumstances should we be sending America‚Äôs strategic oil reserves to China. It is a threat to our energy and national security. Shameful that House Democrats blocked our amendment to prevent this reckless policy from the Biden administration. 

The @China_TaskForce released a comprehensive set of policy proposals that offer a long-term strategy to counter the Chinese Communist Party. Speaker Pelosi played politics and pushed through a far-left wish list instead. 

America needs to take the China threat seriously, but this unserious bill badly misses the mark. The last thing we need right now is a $325 billion partisan spending bill that weakens America‚Äôs economic competitiveness and concedes ground to China. 

The Biden Administration continues to give China a pass. This bill is another Trojan horse for far-left proposals that have little to do with countering China. 

Why is Speaker Pelosi sending congressional offices KN95 masks that are made in China? Your tax dollars at work. Outrageous. 

This is a matter of energy and national security, as well as a human rights imperative. Making America more dependent on China supply chains that rely on forced labor is wrong and weakens our nation across the board.

Today at @HouseCommerce I offered an amendment that would prohibit the use of critical minerals that were mined using forced labor in any foreign country, including China. Unbelievably, Democrats rejected it. 

We need to get to the bottom of the origins of COVID-19. China needs to be held accountable. Read my @detroitnews op-ed  

As the World Health Assembly approaches, we cannot allow a Chinese pressure campaign to exclude Taiwan from the annual meeting. Taiwan is a valued partner and leader in global health initiatives, and there should be no question as to its participation. #LetTaiwanHelp

tweets: 
This is a good step. The Chinese government is one of the major strategic threats our country faces right now. Establishing a Committee that takes a wholistic view of legislation & policy is important for our national security and our economy. 1/2 

3/ In the few months since we passed the CHIPS Act, a whole bunch of companies have already announced plans to build chip plants in the U.S. That means more good-paying manufacturing jobs and a stronger supply chain for chips.

I just got back to DC from our CODEL to the Middle East last night, and this morning I flew to Bay City with @RepDanKildee and @POTUS for an event to talk about how the CHIPS Act is going to bring manufacturing back to places like Michigan. 1/ 

In 2021, I led a bipartisan task force in the Armed Services Committee to look at vulnerabilities in our defense supply chains, & our findings raised serious red flags about our military‚Äôs dependence on materials from halfway around the world, including adversaries like China.

2/ China‚Äôs actions aren‚Äôt merely speculation & rumor, they are known & publicized influence operations. Their efforts are not in keeping with international rules & norms, nor are they consistent with the freedoms & rights enjoyed by American citizens or anyone else on U.S. soil.

For many in the national security world who've been tracking China‚Äôs subversive efforts in the U.S., this is no surprise. But it's a wake-up call when it comes to countering concerted attempts by Chinese intelligence to undermine American institutions. 1/ 

Peter shared with me how many new forges & presses are being built in China, and that more and more manufacturers are now sending their equipment overseas to be repaired. In addition to economic costs & domestic job losses, this raises big national security red flags for me. 2/3

We need to use every tool at our disposal to keep the upper hand when it comes to China ‚Äî that includes making sure we‚Äôre not exporting sensitive, high-tech equipment to an adversary that could one day use it against us. 1/2 

Weaning ourselves ‚Äî and especially our military equipment ‚Äî off of critical Chinese components doesn‚Äôt just happen in its own. It will require policy and law to ensure our economic and national security. 5/

Here‚Äôs the thing: our reliance on China undermines our economic AND national security. That‚Äôs why I'm leading bipartisan bills to keep us safe. The latest - the REEShore & HARD ROCK Acts - build up our critical mineral stockpiles to prevent this exact situation with the F-35. 4/

We found that microchips and the rare earth minerals that make them were an important vulnerability for @DeptofDefense, and passed bipartisan legislation pushing DOD for greater supply chain transparency. 3/

The supply chain story continues: In 2021, after our dependencies on Chinese products like masks became clear during COVID, @RepGallagher & I wondered what dependencies the U.S. military might have on China. 1/ 

The bipartisan infrastructure law, CHIPS Act & the Inflation Reduction Act will build on this momentum to bring our supply chains back from places like China & create jobs with dignity here in Michigan.

It was great to hear their enthusiasm and optimism for the future when we talked about the CHIPS Act and how bringing microchip production back to the U.S. means more stability for the entire auto industry and more jobs for American workers. As Rosie said, ‚ÄúWe Can Do It!‚Äù

As a parts supplier to GM, these women have lived through multiple shut downs over the past year due to the chips shortage and other supply chain issues.

We need to make chips here ‚Äî in America ‚Äî and help our farmers, who have spent the last couple years grappling with the microchip shortage. Today‚Äôs high-tech farming equipment runs on chips, so the shortage has made it much harder for regular folks to repair.

Lastly, I wasn‚Äôt surprised to hear the continued serious strain on our supply chains for farmers, and in particular how badly the microchip shortage is impacting farm equipment. This is another place where the CHIPS Act we passed a few weeks back will help.

6/ And Given the Pentagon‚Äôs strict buy-American requirements for contractors, making these chips here, in the U.S., is critical for our military & our national security.

The signing of the CHIPS Act is a *huge* win for Michigan. Not only will it energize our domestic microchip industry - keeping Michigan‚Äôs auto plants open & their workers on the line - it will also be revolutionary for universities like @MichiganStateU. 1/ 

And as we landed, the Chinese military squawked at our Air Force pilots over the radio, and later sent 27 military aircraft into Taiwan‚Äôs ADIZ in response. This is a sensitive time in China, but now that the Speaker‚Äôs trip is public, she can‚Äôt back down to Chinese threats. 2/2

I visited a Taiwan with a codel in November, and scare tactics are par for the course for the Chinese government: the Chinese Embassy sent a threatening, over-the-top letter to our office to try to dissuade us from visiting. 1/2 

3/ The national security implications are just as important: By bringing this manufacturing back home, we‚Äôre ensuring that we can‚Äôt be held hostage by our adversaries in the event of a conflict with countries like China.

2/ By incentivizing companies to build new microchip plants here in the U.S., instead of places like China, this bill helps prevent future shortages like the ones that have shut down auto plant across the country, including GM‚Äôs Delta Township and Lansing Grand River plants.

I‚Äôve been waiting more than a year to cast my vote for the CHIPS Act, and today I finally got the chance. Passing this bill is a huge win for Michigan‚Äôs workers, our businesses and our national security. 1/ 

6/ If we don‚Äôt shift some of this chip manufacturing to the US, we‚Äôll have to accept that we‚Äôre beholden to foreign suppliers. These microchips are fundamental to nearly every part of our society, & if we in Congress fail to act, we will lose out on a generational opportunity.

5/ I‚Äôve met too many Michigan auto workers who have been laid off because their plant couldn‚Äôt find enough 14-cent microchips to stay open. Right here in my district, GM has had hundreds of finished cars sitting on the lot because they are missing chips.

3/ Right now, just 2% of the storage & memory chips used in our cars and televisions are manufactured in the US, but the CHIPS Act levels the playing field & opens us up to more investment in Michigan and across the country.

2/ Other countries like China are pouring billions into building up their own microchip manufacturing capacity, making their chips about 40% cheaper to produce. If we want to compete, we need to make these investments.

This morning I sat down with representatives from Micron, one of the world‚Äôs largest chip manufacturers. Our conversation made it clear that if we want America to be a global leader in chip production, it‚Äôs crucial that we pass the CHIPS Act & related investment tax credits. 1/ 

The chip shortage is a threat to Michigan's economy AND our national security - that's why we need to pass the CHIPS Act on its own. If Congressional leaders screw this up, the consequences will be dire. Read my op-ed in the @DetroitNews: 

2/ These are the holdover tariffs President Trump imposed. The Chinese retaliated with a whole package of their own tariffs on American goods, especially ag products ‚Äî then the Trump administration offered subsidies to ease the pain on our farmers.

I got asked about the administration potentially lifting tariffs on Chinese imports. As we look to what to do, I come at this from my work at the Pentagon: it‚Äôs all about leverage. 1/ 

We need to invest now in an American supply chain for microchips, so that we aren‚Äôt beholden to foreign countries like China for our economic and national security. It‚Äôs time to pass the deeply bipartisan CHIPS Act as a standalone bill.

.@GM‚Äôs Delta Township plant is shutting down - again - because we can‚Äôt get ahold of 14-cent microchips. Congress‚Äôs failure to pass the CHIPS Act has real world consequences, and it‚Äôs leaving workers in mid-Michigan holding the bag. 

2/ We covered a range of issues, including expanding rural broadband access, keeping the U.S. competitive with China, and leadership lessons for young women interested in government.

China‚Äôs current control over the market for these minerals leaves us dangerously vulnerable. By shoring-up our stockpile and improving transparency, we can make sure we aren‚Äôt left defenseless in the event of a trade dispute or military conflict.

Last year I led a bipartisan task force to examine our defense supply-chains. We took a close look under the hood & didn‚Äôt like what we saw. So today, I‚Äôm unveiling 2 new bills to reduce our reliance on China for critical minerals used by our military. 

When it comes to microchips, I can promise you that China isn‚Äôt dragging their feet. We need your push to have any chance of getting this done by August 1.

As much as I love to hear that Russia‚Äôs military has been forced to use chips from dishwashers, the global shortage is a huge threat to our own national AND economic security. Shame on Congress for dragging our feet on the Bipartisan Innovation Act ‚Äî we need to pass it now. 

The U.S. produces only 12% of the world‚Äôs chips and 0% of the most advanced chips needed for household devices, military devices, & ‚Äî critically for Michigan ‚Äî our cars.

Just had a strong briefing from the @DeptofDefense + the @CommerceGov on the microchip supply chain and the need to move smartly on the CHIPS Act funding and the America COMPETES Act as a whole.

I want our kids working for American companies, not Chinese companies ‚Äì and no matter which way you cut it, Michigan is honoring its heritage and owning the next generation of auto manufacturing.

tweets: 
Powerful cultural underpinnings often find a way to survive changes on the surface in China. Might the current ‚Äúdynasty‚Äù be more vulnerable than we think? Please let me know what you think. <end>

Are any other students of China thinking about this at all? In particular: can a right to rebellion survive in a surveillance state as totalizing as today‚Äôs under ‚ÄúEmperor‚Äù Xi Jinping‚Äôs?

For folks who have studied Chinese history, it‚Äôs hard not to make connections between these authoritarian times and the many centuries of dynastic rule in China.

I read whatever I can find about China‚Äôs recent wave of protests. Many articles, like this one, talk about problems deeper than COVID lockdowns behind the protests. üßµ 

China‚Äôs effort to wipe out Tibetan culture is no less heinous for being slow moving & out of the spotlight. There‚Äôs no more insidious aspect of this attempted erasure than undermining Tibet‚Äôs millennia old language, the heartbeat of any people‚Äôs identity. 

I'm grateful that @DOD_Policy is taking a step back to review its policies governing clandestine use of social media as part of its information operations. From Burma to Russia to Iran to China, we've seen the damage done when disinformation proliferates. 

House Democrats continue to deliver and put #PeopleOverPolitics. In the past few months, we‚Äôve passed the Inflation Reduction Act, the CHIPS and Science Act, the Respect for Marriage Act, the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act and so much more!

This is report confirms what we know to be true. The U.S. must continue to do all that it can to hold the Chinese government and any complicit corporations accountable for these abuses.

The U.S. and our allies and partners must do everything we can to help Ukraine beat back the Russian invaders, and to do more to share the burden of our collective defense and bolster our deterrence of Russia, China and all other threats to the transatlantic community.

As China engages in a reckless, aggressive demonstration to threaten Taiwan, we must project strength, rather than offer empty, conciliatory gestures. We cannot afford to mortgage our future security to appease bullies like Xi and Putin. 

I support Speaker Pelosi‚Äôs trip to Taiwan. For decades, members of Congress have traveled to Taiwan. This travel is consistent with the U.S.'s One China policy to which we are committed. We are also committed now, more than ever, to all elements of the Taiwan Relations Act.

While I will always support increasing American competitiveness, this bill boosting funding for the American semiconductor manufacturing sector all but ignores our top priority when it comes to competition with China: our military. 

With the Chinese Navy steadily growing to 460 ships by 2030, we must stop the unforced errors in Navy shipbuilding. The #FY23NDAA will push the Navy to leverage best practices so we can grow our fleet to compete with China. 

China. Russia. Iran. North Korea. Terrorists. Inflation. A recruitment crisis. We are facing the most serious set of national security challenges I‚Äôve seen in my lifetime. Congress can respond by passing the #FY23NDAA. I urge @SenSchumer to bring this bill to the floor ASAP.

With all the threats we face, especially from China and Russia, Congress must make sure our military has the resources and equipment needed to deter our enemies and, if necessary, to fight and win. That's what this year's National Defense Authorization Act does. #FY23NDAA 

We need to keep pace with our greatest threat, China, while responding to the severe challenges posed by Vladimir Putin‚Äôs Russia in Europe. This year‚Äôs NDAA paves the way to do just that. 

The Chinese Communist Party appears to be continuing its unprecedented military expansion. As we consider this year‚Äôs #NDAA and our military posture in the region, including through the Pacific Deterrence Initiative, protecting a free and open Indo-Pacific must be a priority. 

I‚Äôve written a letter w/ @senrobportman urging President Biden to retain U.S. tariffs on billions of dollars‚Äô worth of China-made products. These tariffs target China's illegal and unfair trade practices and must be kept. More below: 

From the get-go, I‚Äôve been alarmed by China‚Äôs tacit support for Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine. It becomes clearer every day that the interests of the Chinese Communist Party are diametrically opposed to those of America. We must prepare for a long competition. 

Promising results from Air Force‚Äôs recent hypersonic missile test. However, until we consistently provide @DeptofDefense with the real budget growth it needs, China‚Äôs and Russia‚Äôs lead in hypersonic strike capabilities will only grow larger. #FY23NDAA 

With the Chinese Navy steadily climbing to 460 ships by 2030, the unforced errors in Navy shipbuilding, like the Littoral Combat Ship, must stop. Programs that can scale up and grow our fleet must be the priority. 

"It takes us three years to do what China can do in three days," our other witness said. That's eroding our comparative advantage. 

The dramatic growth in the number of Chinese Navy warships has been fueled by international sales of commercial ships built in the same shipyards. This must stop - buy from Allies! 

.@WSJ has it right: ‚ÄúThe bill for decades of complacency and neglect is coming due at a dangerous moment, as China ramps up its fleet.‚Äù Congress must act and give our military the resources it needs! 

Pleased to see DOD & NNSA continuing long-overdue investments to rebuild our aging nuclear forces, but I'm still concerned that the administration remains unwilling to reclaim the ground we‚Äôve already lost to China & Russia. Expect #FY2023NDAA to put us back on a more secure path 

I led Congress in creating the Pacific Deterrence Initiative to help improve our military posture in that region. As long as we resource it properly, it could be a game changer in long-term competition against China as well.

With increasingly capable Chinese and Russian submarines on patrol more often, the effect of canceling the fatally flawed LCS ASW package is at least an 11-year gap in ASW frigates. Another unacceptable Navy acquisition debacle. 

The @USNavy says we need at least 355 battle force ships to counter future threats from China & Russia. @POTUS‚Äôs budget takes a step backward ‚Äì decommissioning 24 while building just 8 new ones. This puts us on track to a SMALLER Navy fleet over the next 5 years. Illogical. 

Since Putin‚Äôs indiscriminate killing of women and children and bombing of hospitals and schools isn‚Äôt enough for President Xi to close the door on Russia, @POTUS must make it clear: If China provides Russia with military aid, there will be a price to pay.

Why would China give more weapons to Putin, who has shown his willingness to use those weapons to bomb hospitals and apartment buildings in Ukraine?

Agree with @US_STRATCOM ADM Richard's statements at today‚Äôs hearing. We are in a new era. The time has come to look at what additional nuclear capabilities we need before China and Russia leave us behind. 

Far from making the U.S. and its allies safer, hollowing out our nuclear forces only invites further Russian, Chinese aggression. The upcoming Nuclear Posture Review needs to focus on rebuilding a deterrent capable of meeting the growing threats we face.

The Biden administration's approach to the Indo-Pacific leaves a lot to be desired. I remain very concerned that their actions will not match their rhetoric when it comes to being tough on China. My full statement on the new Indo-Pacific Strategy ‚Üì 

China & Russia are using Africa to expand their influence & military reach & the terrorist threat in Africa is expanding. Yet we've never given @USAfricaCommand the resources it needs. I'm glad to receive a commitment from a key @DeptofDefense nominee to make this a priority. 

Russia. China. North Korea. We face growing threats around the world ‚Äî we can‚Äôt let our military slide backwards after years of gains. Adequate, full-year national security funding must be Congress‚Äô top priority. 

One of the most important things this year‚Äôs NDAA does is direct much-needed resources to the Indo-Pacific and reorients the Pacific Deterrence Initiative toward making real improvements to U.S. force posture in the Indo-Pacific to deter Chinese aggression.

A vote to discharge this resolution is a vote to give Iran and China and Russia more power and influence in the region, and will make our world less safe.

We need to stand strong against China and Russia. That's why @SenSchumer's Senate #FY22NDAA process is a failure. He's more concerned about protecting the Biden administration instead of American families. My full statement on today's floor vote ‚Üì 

The Biden administration is yet again tone deaf on nuclear policy. China is building hundreds of new ICBMs at a breakneck pace, and Russia‚Äôs arsenal already surpasses ours. We must modernize our nuclear forces to deter these growing threats. 

We‚Äôre continuing to see technology that‚Äôs more & more advanced from China. As @SecDef put it, China is our ‚Äúpacing threat‚Äù & we are failing to keep up. If we want to catch up, we need to speed up investment and reduce bureaucracy at the @DeptofDefense.

Our military‚Äôs #2 says China‚Äôs recent missile test looks like a ‚Äúfirst-use weapon‚Äù ‚Äì meaning they‚Äôre designing it so they can strike us 1st. Talk of changing US nuclear policies flies in the face of facts. If @POTUS changes our policies, it makes us & our allies more vulnerable 

I‚Äôm not the only one who‚Äôs very concerned about what China is doing with hypersonic weapons. My colleagues in Congress agree that we have to invest in our military to maintain a favorable balance of power ‚Äì and deter China from a position of strength. 

I‚Äôve talked repeatedly about China building replicas of our ships & aircraft for target practice. Now, we have a picture of a mock US aircraft carrier w/escorts on rails so the PLA can practice hitting it while moving. We need to do more & move faster to be ready for this threat. 

Meanwhile, in the three months since the Armed Services Committee passed this bill, the threats we face around the world ‚Äî China and Russia, North Korea and Iran, terrorist organizations in Afghanistan ‚Äî have only gotten worse.

As China & Russia rapidly modernize & expand their militaries, @DeptofDefense has instead focused on @POTUS's progressive social agenda. I led my @SASCGOP colleagues in asking Gen. Milley for more info so we can understand how this misplaced focus affects military readiness. 

China‚Äôs relentless expansion of its nuclear arsenal continues unchecked. A new @DeptofDefense report says China is likely to have >1,000 nukes by 2030. Yet @POTUS remains unconcerned ‚Äì just like with Afghanistan, he‚Äôs dangerously disconnected! More

.@POTUS can‚Äôt ignore our allies and partners: A ‚ÄúNo First Use‚Äù or ‚ÄúSole Purpose‚Äù nuclear policy would be a ‚Äúhuge gift to China and Russia,‚Äù - fracturing our alliances, undermining our credibility and inviting aggression.

The strengthening of ties between the militaries of Russia and the Chinese Communist Party should raise a red flag among many in the international community. 

This show of force is unacceptable and dangerous. The people of Taiwan should not be subject to these dangerous incursions by the Chinese Communist Party and its military. 

While these dismissals appear proper, they don't address the significant concerns that remain about the Chinese Communist Party's control of TikTok and ByteDance. 

Under the laws of the People's Republic of China, the Chinese Communist Party potentially has access to the personal data of 140 million Americans who use TikTok at any time without disclosure. 

The ANTI-SOCIAL CCP Act, which I've partnered on with @SenRubioPress and @RepGallagher, is about protecting our national security and ensuring millions of Americans' data isn't leveraged for nefarious means by the Chinese Communist Party. 

ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, is required by Chinese law to share the app's data with the Chinese Communist Party. We must take action now to protect Americans' data, and our national security, from foreign adversaries leveraging social media. 

An important step in holding both Russia and China accountable for their conduct. 

Yesterday, I led a letter to Twitter requesting information about the CCP's potential use of misinformation campaigns on the platform to bury information about protests in the People's Republic of China, and how this could affect U.S. national security. 

Chinese hackers stealing more than $20 million in government pandemic relief funds is troubling news that must be fully investigated so that we can bring those responsible to justice and ensure that an attack like this never succeeds again. 

Thanks to the bipartisan CHIPS Act, the first advanced chip plant in the U.S. is set to open in Arizona, another step in our work to get America back to the top of the semiconductor industry globally, while also generating new jobs here in America.

By partnering with Japan and other like-minded allies, we can work to secure global supply chains, outcompete the Chinese Communist Party, and promote stability and security.

Last night, the Senate passed a bill to ban TikTok on all government devices. This action is long overdue and critical to our national security. Digital platforms must never provide a back door to monitoring by the Chinese government. 

The Chinese Communist Party knows America is on offense following passage of the CHIPS and Science Act. I am confident American innovation and values will prevail in the battle to lead the global economy. 

It's essential that we outcompete China. While progress has been made with my CHIPS and Science Act, there is much more to be done. 

America is on offense against the Chinese Communist Party. Thanks to the CHIPS and Science Act, we are increasing domestic chip production to strengthen our national security and protect our supply chains.

"The recent passing of the federal CHIPS and Science Act was a major step forward for maintaining America‚Äôs competitiveness on the world stage." 

I joined with a bipartisan group of Senate colleagues in a letter to the Chinese ambassador warning the CCP of the consequences of a violent crackdown on peaceful protesters. We must speak up for up for the Chinese people when they are threatened with authoritarian brutality. 

The Chinese Communist Party‚Äôs restrictive digital trade policies enable the CCP to exploit data for its authoritarian objectives. To break the CCP‚Äôs grasp, the United States must solidify strong, pro-freedom digital trade rules with our partners.

The Chinese people are demonstrating great courage in the face of the Chinese Communist Party‚Äôs authoritarian rule. President Xi should back away from his absurd COVID-zero policy instead of cracking down on innocent people who want freedom. 

Amazing images from China as large protests have erupted in response to the CCP continuing to restrict the freedoms of the Chinese people. #BeijingBehavingBadly 

An exciting announcement for NSWC Crane and Southern Indiana: more semiconductor jobs are coming to Indiana in the wake of the CHIPS and Science Act. Hoosiers are leading in the emerging technologies critical to our economic and national security. 

Critical minerals that go into advanced technologies will be the oil of the next century. We cannot allow China to monopolize these resources and become the OPEC of the future. Kudos to our Canadian allies for identifying the threat and taking action. 

I am proud of the role that Indiana & @NAVSEACrane are playing within the @DeptofDefense to utilize resources provided by the CHIPS & Science Act to advance our national security. 

In China, there is no distinction between private businesses and Chinese government and security entities. @TheJusticeDept‚Äôs announcement yesterday is yet another reminder of the threat that Chinese tech companies pose to our national security. 

Helping Taiwan shore up its defenses to thwart the Chinese Communist Party‚Äôs ambitions must be a top U.S. national security priority. Our goal in Taiwan should be to deter an attack in the first place, not just respond if China takes action.

‚ÄúA recent study estimates that a one-year disruption in the production of semiconductors in Taiwan would lead to a $490 billion drop in revenue for electronic-device makers, not counting fallout for sectors that aren‚Äôt directly reliant on semiconductors.‚Äù 

.@Mikepompeo and @VivekGRamaswamy highlight why the threat to Taiwan matters and the potential implications for global supply chains. It‚Äôs never been more critical to increase domestic chip production as the CHIPS and Science Act will help do. 

Today, I wish the Taiwanese people a Happy Taiwan National Day. I'm proud to stand with Taiwan as they celebrate their freedom, their democracy, and their sovereignty.

All eyes are on Indiana as we prepare to boost our national security and our workforce through the CHIPS and Science Act. Thanks @SecRaimondo and @SecBlinken for visiting @LifeatPurdue and seeing the work Hoosiers are doing to out-innovate and outcompete China. 

Great to meet with Dr. Dukgeun Ahn, South Korea‚Äôs Minister for Trade, to talk about the partnership between our countries. South Korea is an important ally in our global competition with China. 

My CHIPS and Science Act is now law, and America is back on offense against the Chinese Communist Party. Beijing has invested heavily in tech innovation, but with this law, the U.S. is in position to out-innovate and outcompete the CCP in the years ahead. 

The Chinese government continues to commit horrific acts against the Uyghur community. Governments and industry must speak up for those being oppressed. #BeijingBehavingBadly 

Read my op-ed on how the CHIPS and Science Act positions Indiana and our nation to out-innovate and outcompete China. 

No sector is safe from this shortage. The new CHIPS and Science Act, which I worked on for over two years, encourages domestic semiconductor production so our Hoosier farmers will not face these challenges in the future. 

Today, America goes on offense against the Chinese Communist Party. History will show that by enacting this legislation into law, we are confronting the challenges of today and building a more prosperous and secure tomorrow for all Americans. 

Great to meet with my friend @DrPanch to learn how @NSF is ready to hit the ground running on implementing my CHIPS and Science Act. This will make us more competitive with China, and I am grateful for his vision of unleashing American innovation. 

The Chinese Communist Party is a challenge to American interests not just in the Indo-Pacific but across the Middle East, Africa, and other regions. As we seek to counter the CCP‚Äôs influence, the U.S. must remain an engaged global partner for our allies. 

This morning: I joined @WOWOFORTWAYNE to discuss why it was important for @SpeakerPelosi to follow through on her planned trip to Taiwan.

The Senate just passed landmark legislation to help our country outcompete and out-innovate the Chinese Communist Party. This is a massive win for our economic and national security. 

Headed to pass my China competitiveness bill

This morning, the Senate voted to advance my bill to outcompete China and boost domestic chip production. I joined @BloombergTV to discuss why this legislation is critical to our national security. 

Beijing has been very clear about its desire to forcibly bring the vibrant democracy in Taiwan under its communist rule. We must stand firm and be unambiguous about support for Taiwan‚Äôs independence.

If the U.S. is to deter an invasion of Taiwan, we must boost the readiness of their military, deliver the capabilities they require, and clarify that we won‚Äôt accept any attempt to conquer this vibrant democracy and valued partner. 

My bill to outcompete China will make possible new chip research and production investments in the U.S., like @SkyWaterFoundry‚Äôs announcement that it will invest $1.8 billion in a new Indiana facility. It‚Äôs time to get this bill across the finish line. 

Tonight‚Äôs procedural vote is an important first step toward the Senate passing a robust ‚ÄúCHIPS Plus‚Äù package. The strong bipartisan vote shows there is broad support for including the USICA provisions critical to our national security and ability to outcompete China.

Authoritarian regimes in Russia, China, and elsewhere are using economic intimidation to influence countries around the globe. My new bipartisan bill will help our partners stand up to these regimes when targeted. 

Some foreign adversaries, like China & Russia, think they can drive a wedge between Western allies by using economic intimidation. When America provides targeted support to our partners under threat, we also protect our own national security interests. 

Another example of #BeijingBehavingBadly -- the Chinese Communist Party employing hackers and a global network of spies to steal Western technology companies‚Äô intellectual property. 

Exciting news for our state ‚Äì today @MediaTek announced plans to create its first Midwest semiconductor chip design center in partnership with @LifeAtPurdue. This center will create jobs, drive collaboration, and deepen ties between Taiwan & Indiana. 

A major example of #BejingBehavingBadly is China profiting from the forced labor of Uyghurs. @JoshRogin is right - the Biden Administration needs to fully enforce the law Congress passed to cripple China‚Äôs forced-labor industry.

It is time to bring cutting edge research & development and manufacturing back home. As @ericschmidt and @GrahamTAllison point out, every day we delay passing my #USICA and CHIPS Act funding, we fall further behind in this global competition. 

When China controls the technology, everything, including your data, is used on their terms. #BeijingBehavingBadly 

Joined @BloombergTV to discuss the situation in Ukraine and the national security imperative of passing my legislation to help the U.S. outcompete and out-innovate the Chinese Communist Party. 

China, Russia, & COVID have demonstrated the significant threats facing our global supply chains. Partnering with allies in our own hemisphere & here at home to build the economy of the future will reduce these risks and bolster our national security. 

With the Chinese Communist Party threatening Taiwan, securing our supply of semiconductors is of vital importance to our national security. We need to pass my #USICA legislation in order to make critical investments in homegrown chips manufacturing.

The United States is facing a global challenge from the Chinese Communist Party. I discussed why passing #USICA is critical to ensuring the U.S. leads the world into the future. @fdd Watch:
